If you like to watch dumb, cruel people abuse animals, this is the movie for you. Mob types fighting dogs for $. Travolta plays the dumbest (loser) character on the planet in this movie that does not deserve to be raising a child or a dog. The dog is the star of the movie and almost kills him/her self chasing the lead characters across the country. The dog is abused and abandoned by "everyone" but the little girl in this movie. After 1 1/2 hours of animal abuse it does have a happy ending, but just barely. I understand that this type of behavior exists in our society but I do not know why someone wants to put it on the big screen. This movie pissed me off. I just wanted the dog to kill everyone in the movie except the little girl and then the movie could be over.

Confusing story about a person (Travolta) starting out as a "looser" and ending up as a "looser".  The best story of the movie was the dog portraying an arena fighting dog that turns it's life around and becomes the little girl's best friend and protector.  The title is also disjointed.  I never figured out who has the "Eyes of an Angel".  Was it Travolta's eyes, the little girl's eyes, OR was it the eyes of the beautiful dog?  Sorry Travolta, but this was not one of your best.  Your performance was "rusty" at best.

Definitely not Travolta's best film, but if you are a dog lover (especially if you've had the pleasure of living with a doberman), you will still like this movie.  It is a little brutal at first, so i almost couldn't keep watching if it was going to continue that way much longer.  There a few moments where this film will pull at your heart strings. Overall it is a heart warming film that portrays the doberman much more accurately than many other films have.  I am glad that someone made this movie even though it is a little rough around the edges.

This is one of the most amazing pet themed stories I know of. I've been trying to get it for about 20 years & I could never find it available. When I found it on your site I was reluctant to pay the price so I put off buying it until I convinced myself I needed a treat. This story is right up there with Hachi or Old Yeller.
I love Dobermans and this movie shows how loyal they really are. Really good movie for all. There is no nudity but, there is some language that might not be appropriate for younger children.

hi, i just wated to thank you, got this movie, much sooner then exspected, thank you very much, and movie was as you described in excelent condition, the disk it self looks brand spanking new. art work is excelent condition as well, i lived in indiana years ago, syracuse, ind, that helped make my mind up to buy, most people i met there were straight shooters,and yes i woud recamend you to a friend, or familey, as well.  ted

Captivating storyline between girl and dog. Alot of content is much too violent for youngsters; this is a film for adult audiences. Hard-hitting and yet tender. Love the film. WANT IT ON DVD!!!

My husband and I are true dog lovers! We have two dogs, an Alaskan Malamute and a mixed breed dog that I rescued. This movie touched a place in my heart I never thought I would have towards a pet. It's a beautiful story of a dog's loyalty to a little girl who saved his life. I've never had a Doberman before but I see the same characteristics in my little dog and every time I see this movie I can't help but cry tears of joy and happiness knowing that I have a dog who is as loyal as the Dobe in this film. Even if you're not a dog owner/lover you can still relate but I know this movie will definitley touch the hearts and eyes of dog owners/lovers. As you know it stars the one and only John Travolta! I wouldn't consider it an "early' Saturday Night Fever, Carrie, Grease, Urban Cowboy, Staying Alive, Moment by Moment, Look Who's Talkin' 1 and 2, these are all mid 70's to mid 90's movies. BTW Eyes of An Angel was 1991. Regardless, hands down this was a phenomenal movie that is needed in every home. I paid a pretty penny for mine and it's worth every red hot cent!

This was my 1st buy on Amazon and it was a pleasure. Everything was exactly as described and arrived perfectly fine.  Good movie it's a different type for John Travolta but he was  great as usual. Especially  loved the Doberman , such a sweet intelligent dog.
Will do business again.
Lynne

I had to write this only because at least two reviews here comment that this is "early Travolta." Saturday Night Fever (1977) / Staying Alive (1983) (Double Feature),Grease (Rockin' Rydell Edition), and Welcome Back, Kotter - The Complete First Season, are early Travolta. He has been famous since the mid 70's and I'd hardly call this movie -- when John Travolta was almost 40 years old -- representative of his "early" work. But, hey, I guess that says something for his continued appeal. Regarding the movie itself, it was okay but nothing special. The acting is fine, and the dog is amazing, but the story (when it's not dealing directly with the relationship between the girl and the dobe) is rather boring. So if you love dogs...this is worth a look if it shows up on cable, but I wouldn't go out of my way to see it.

I just saw "Eyes of an Angel" for the first time. I had never heard of it. Although other reviews on this page are glowing, I would only give it a "3" out of a 5 star rating.  It is early Travolta, but the story has its heart in the right place. I think the characters of Travolta and his daughter could have been given a little more insight for the viewer. I agree with the other reviewers, the true hero in this movie is the dog. The movie would be good for the 8 to 17 year old age group.

This movie was a complete surprise to me. It's beautifully and realistically filmed, with highly credible acting by everyone, including the beautiful dobie..I've never seen a movie that gave me a better sense of perspective from the dog's view. I feel fortunate to have a copy of it and find it's a wonderful 'pick me up' on a blue day..The movie conveys a powerful message of hope under seemingly hopeless circumstances. I would recommend  "Eyes of an Angel" to everyone.

This movie just shows the dedication that dogs have for people they love.  They will go to extreme lenghts to protect the people that they love and who have shown them love.  Unconditonal love is what we get from our pets, this movie will have you rooting for the dog and praying for the  people he loves. It doesn't start out very fast paced but once you get involved you can't leave the screen til you find out what happens.  Dobies are our dog of choice so this was especially meaningful to us.  The little girl befriends this dog and in turn he becomes her hero and protector.  Wonderful story, I love to watch it over and over again!!!!  Other recommendations would be "The Doberman Gang" "Those Amazing Dobermans" and the "Daring Dobermans".

I saw this movie several years ago on HBO, but have never been able to find it to purchase. Fantastic story, but the best character in the story is the Dobe. As one who has had at least two for the last 20 years, they are that loyal. They look mean, but for "their people" they are big softies, and they will get to you. Early Travolta, but good.

A story of a girl who meets a fighting dog, that's probably the nicest dog ever. She wants to keep him but her father(Travolta) won't let her. He's already working on low wage, then his wife's(who's dead) cousin is trying to rip Travolta off! A GREAT story! Watch it!!

Have this movie taped, but wanted a new copy.
A very hard to find film, but really worth the watch.  Wouldn't care what it cost if it came out on DVD I'd buy it.
Without giving anything away, I had a dog that looked like this one.
It truly touched my heart more than any other movie I've ever seen.

I have been looking for this video after seeing it on cable.  I cant find it anywhere!  It  tells about the disgusting ways of man, blood thirsty & money grubbing.  And also, the bond between a dog & a child. Very moving.  I loved it.

This story of cruel treatment by having  a Doberman as dogfight injured, shows the resilience of a Doberman.  I've rescued two Dobermans that became extremely loyal & protective to my family.  Both of them became therapy dogs which I took to nearby nursing homes.  There is another version of this movie in a different setting, but similar story line.  It is somewhere on internet which you might locate w/ some  research.  This
movie deserves being reproduced at a more affordable cost.
Touching story...portrays a Doberman in the lead role (sorry Mr. Travolta!).
